question_sentence: How many cups of coffee a day can help reduce risk of liver cancer, according to a new study?
choices: Coffee doesn't decrease the risk of liver cancer.

question_sentence: Carl Nassib came out as the first active, openly gay NFL player this week. Which team is he signed to?
Which sandwich shop’s tuna had no traces of fish, according to a DNA test in a New York Times investigation?
Which major airline cut almost 1,000 flights from its July schedule?
Steven Spielberg signed a production deal with which streaming giant?
The Biden administration said it won’t make its 70% COVID-19 vaccine goal by July 4. Which age group lags behind?
NASA is giving the public the opportunity to name which object that it is sending into space?
An Indiana woman who became the first  person to be sentenced in the Capitol riots pleaded guilty in exchange for all of the following except:
What was Britney Spears’ father’s response after the pop star made shocking revelations at her conservatorship hearing this week?
choices: He said he misses his daughter.

question_sentence: Which isn’t true about John McAfee, the antivirus software entrepreneur found dead in prison on Wednesday?
choices: He was a "'person of interest" in the killing of his neighbor.
His fortune dwindled from $100 million to $5,000.
Tax-related charges against him carried a 30-year sentence.

question_sentence: What is the name of the British warship at which Russia claims to have fired warning shots this week for sailing through disputed waters near Crimea?
Far-left politician George Galloway is standing against which Labour Party candidate in the 1 July by-election in Batley and Spen?
Cristiano Ronaldo has equalled the record set by Iran striker Ali Daei by scoring a total of how many goals in men’s international football history?
What is the name of the far-right Belgian soldier found dead after deserting his military base and threatening to kill the country’s most prominent virologist?
Up to how many spectators will be allowed to attend each event at the Tokyo Olympics despite fears of Covid-19 outbreaks?
A newly published report from MPs has claimed that the use of the phrase ‘white privilege’ has contributed to the what of white working-class pupils?
Vote Leave campaign’s in the run-up to the Brexit referendum exactly five years ago this week included a claim plastered on a battle bus that the UK sent the EU how much each week?
The UK is negotiating to join a total of 11 countries including which of the following in the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP) trading bloc?
The Queen used which phrase to describe beleaguered Health Secretary Matt Hancock during a meeting with Boris Johnson this week?
Edwin Poots has quit as leader of the Democratic Unionist Party after how many days in the job?
Brazil just crossed a tragic threshold in coronavirus deaths, and maintains the second-highest death count in the world due to Covid-19. About how many deaths has the country seen from the virus?
evidence: Brazil has lost more than 500,000 people to the virus, second only to the United States which has recorded more than 600,000 total deaths.

question_sentence: Tokyo 2020 announced that this summer’s Olympic games will, in fact, go on. What is the current plan for spectators?
choices: No restrictions. Venues can operate at full capacity.
Spectators must stay in a certain area for three days before and after they attend.
There will be a 50% capacity limit put on event venues.
evidence: The Olympic games will go on with a 50% capacity cap put on all venues, with a maximum of 10,000 spectators allowed.

question_sentence: New York City residents voted in the city’s primaries this week. This election used a special type of voting system that involves choosing more than one candidate for each role. What is the system called?
evidence: New York City employed ranked-choice voting, a system where voters rank their top five candidates in order of preference. It’s the United States’ largest jurisdiction to give the voting system a try.

question_sentence: Hundreds of unmarked graves have been discovered at the site of an Indian Residential School in which country?
evidence: The tragic discovery was made in Canada after Indigenous leaders began radar searching the school grounds. At least 750 unmarked graves were found, a total that is “the most significantly substantial to date in Canada,” the Federation of Sovereign Indigenous Nations said.

question_sentence: The White House has acknowledged that it’s not going to reach a specific goal it set for July 4th. What goal is missing the mark?
choices: to have an infrastructure bill signed into law
to have all troops out of Afghanistan
to have an official G7 agreement on climate change
to have 70% of adults vaccinated for Covid-19
evidence: The US will fall short of having 70% of adult Americans with at least one Covid-19 vaccine shot by the Fourth of July.

question_sentence: Apple Daily, a flagship tabloid and pro-democracy newspaper, is being forced to close due to hostility toward its journalists and external financial pressure and threats. Where is the publication based?
evidence: Following relentless pressure in the aftermath of a Beijing-imposed National Security Law, Apple Daily shut its doors in Hong Kong – marking an end to one of the region’s largest bastions of pro-democratic sentiment and freedom of speech.

question_sentence: Carl Nassib just became the first active NFL player to announce he is gay. What team does he currently play for?
evidence: Nassib plays in the NFL as a defensive lineman with the Las Vegas Raiders. “I’ve been meaning to do this for a while now, but I finally feel comfortable enough to get it off my chest,” he said in an Instagram Live post.

question_sentence: Which celebrity icon appeared in a virtual court hearing this week, requesting an end to a years-long legal restriction in place against them?
evidence: Britney Spears asked during a court hearing for an end to her nearly 13-year, court-ordered conservatorship. Spears said, “I just want my life back. It’s been 13 years and it’s enough.”

question_sentence: Jamaican track and field star Usain Bolt and partner Kasi Bennet announced the birth of twin sons. One of the boys is named Saint Leo. What’s the other twin’s name?
evidence: The dynamic duo’s sons are named Thunder and Saint Leo, almost a year after welcoming Olympia Lightning, their first child together.

question_sentence: According to an article published in the journal BMC Public Health, consuming this drink could specifically cut one’s risk of liver disease.
evidence: The article states that drinking three to four cups of coffee daily – of any kind, caffeinated or decaffeinated— can significantly reduce your risk of developing and dying from chronic liver diseases.
